intro: Bomarea calcensis, commonly known as the limestone bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in regions with limestone soils. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, often violet or purple-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are known for their ornamental value. Bomarea calcensis is adapted to thrive in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in shaded, moist habitats.
